Some of the largest torrent providers require their torrents to be in this format for quicker dls. ILT for example. It only takes 30 secs to change to reg avi so what is the big deal, if you don't know how to do this you can't dl from most torrent providers anyway and if you don't have the 30 sec to change it or dl changer which is free anywhere you shouldn't be able to watch the film anyway.

********hello****** if a file has many peices it's just an .rar file. go to piratebay search and type in winrar and download winrar pro v3.91 (cracked) install winrar. after install go to movie files and right click on  part01 click on extract here and it will auto extract all the rar files to a single movie file which you can play. also after you have the single movie file its ok to delete the rar files to save disk space. your welcome if this is helpful

@raa174 that is not really correct, it is required because RAR files cannot be incorrectly transmitted over the internet - that is to say it cannot drop bytes or kilobytes. AVI files and the like, however can, which can sometimes render the file completely useless.

Hey... thx for the upload... but, I thought I should let you know, in a torrent, splitting rars SERVES NO PURPOSE WHATSOEVER. It is a waste of time for the poster and the downloaders. On USENET, rars and pars are essential. But in a torrent... its a meaningless waste of time. Please tell all your torrent uploaders, rar-ing is for fags and morons.

Here's a nice essay on why you should always unrar files before torrenting:

http://torrentfreak.com/unpack-rar-archives-before-you-release-a-torrent/

To sum it up, you don't need to worry about checksums when you torrent. raring is a waste of time. Please... let everyone know raring is unnecessary and a nuisance. Please stop the rar on torrents!! unrar, then torrent!

wait are the guys bitching about too many files really serious? I mean i've been downloading torrents for what feels like a decade and i find it hard to believe that there are still people who have never heard of compressed files. In any case the movie looks good and if you want better quality and wait a while for dvd quality. Patience is a virtue.

@fuckintorrents ---- while what you say is true that also means you are not seeding after downloading which is oneof the main reasons I do not like the .rar format torrents -- I understand that for some sites it is required due to size\upload restrictions but when someone downloads -unrars and deletes that means they do not stick around to seed for others and if you want to seed you have to keep the extra 800MB of rar files sitting on your HDD which can add up fairly quickly if seeding a lot of files.
